def: The name for all the activities in managing the transformation process
The process of changing inputs such as labour services into goods and services that can be sold
The method of production in which a product is supplied to meet the exact requirements of a customer
When an item moves continuously from one stage of the process to another
When individuals focus on a limited number of tasks
An approach to production that aims to minimise waste
Where a business holds as little stock as possible. Items are ordered just in time to be used
This means continuous development. It is an approach to production that aims to achieve change from a series of small steps
An approach to quality in which everyone is focused on preventing errors occuring and ensuring quality at each stage of the production process
Where a business holds stocks just in case there is a delay from suppliers or a sudden unexpected increase in demand
When the cost per unit falls if large orders are placed with suppliers due to a bulk discount
Where businesses select suppliers - establish terms of payment and negotiate a contract
This refers to all the businesses - people and activities that take part in the production processes from start until it arrives with the customer
This refers to the movement of goods - services - information and money throughout the production process
The part of a business activity that is concerned with meeting the customers needs as fully as possible
When customers have a good experience from their contact with the business
Meeting customers needs after they have purchased the product
The buildings used by businesses - these may include offices - shops and factories
Where customers make repeat purchases because they prefer those products instead of the rival options
The act of buying or selling a product using an electronic system like the internet
Buying and selling products through wireless handheld devices like smartphones
Where a market is made up of customers from across the world
Online methods of communication such as websites and applications. They share information and help develop contacts
Where data is gathered an examined to provide useful information that can be used for decision making
